item.title: 格雷格斯股价下跌，减肥药被认为将冲击销售额
item.description: Greggs Plc shares declined after Jefferies warned weight-loss drugs are hitting sales at the British baker of goods like sausage rolls and donuts.

item.title: Confidence Runs Thin Among Stock Traders
item.description:
持续高企的波动率与低迷的成交量表明，在抛售后市场信心不足。

【原文：

Still-elevated volatility and muted volume show lack of conviction after selloff.

】

item.title: 拉丁美洲表现最佳的债券仍有进一步上涨空间
item.description: 今年，智利电信公司债券的表现超越了所有拉丁美洲同类债券，因竞购这家亏损企业的竞争日趋激烈，令投资者始料未及，并助推了市场对其进一步上涨的预期。【原文：Telefónica Moviles Chile SA bonds have outperformed all of their Latin American peers this year as competition to buy the loss-making company heats up, catching investors by surprise and fueling expectations of further gains.】

item.title: Roblox Under Scrutiny in Australia Amid Child-Grooming Concerns
item.description: 澳大利亚数字监管机构表示，正就Roblox公司是否遵守其自身承诺保障儿童安全展开审查。此前有越来越多担忧指出，该平台存在诱骗儿童及性剥削的潜在风险。【原文：Australia’s digital regulator said it’s testing Roblox Corp.’s compliance with its own commitments to keep kids safe as concerns grow about potential child grooming and sexual exploitation on the platform.】

item.title: 厄立特里亚否认入侵埃塞俄比亚，两国紧张局势持续升级
item.description: 厄立特里亚否认其军队占领埃塞俄比亚边境地区的说法，两国边境地区紧张局势不断升级，外界担忧冲突可能重燃。【原文：Eritrea has denied claims its troops are occupying Ethiopian regions along their common border, amid rising tensions between the neighbors and fears of a resumption of conflict.】

item.title: 泰国改革派政客选举失利后面临终身禁令
item.description: 泰国一亲民主政党逾三十名前议员面临终身禁政令，因该国反贪机构认定他们在修改冒犯国王法案的失败尝试中违反道德标准。【原文：More than three dozen former lawmakers of a pro-democracy party in Thailand face a lifetime ban from politics after the nation’s anti-graft agency found them in breach of ethical standards over a failed bid to amend the royal insult law.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行计划推出与10亿英镑贷款池挂钩的可转换债券，以推动并购活动
item.description: 西班牙银行桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）正通过收购在美国和英国扩张业务，计划发行一项重大风险转移工具，该工具与一笔超过10亿英镑（14亿美元）的贷款组合挂钩。【原文：Banco Santander SA, the Spanish lender expanding via acquisitions in US and the UK, is planning to issue a significant risk transfer tied to a pool of over £1 billion ($1.4 billion) loans.】

item.title: S&P 500’s $1 Trillion Rebound Offers Wall Street Little Solace
item.description: 股市专业人士对美国股市能否延续上周人工智能引发暴跌后1万亿美元的反弹走势，表现出信心不足。【原文：Stock pros are signaling limited conviction in the US equity market’s ability to build on its $1 trillion rebound from last week’s artificial intelligence-driven rout.】

item.title: 卡塔尔将大型液化天然气扩建项目启动时间推迟至2026年末
item.description: QatarEnergy is pushing the start of its multibillion-dollar liquefied natural gas expansion project to as late as the end of the year, a move that’s likely to keep global markets tighter for longer.

item.title: 棕榈油价格或跌破4000令吉，因豆油供应激增
item.description: 资深贸易商多拉布·米斯特里表示，随着南美大豆油大量涌入印度等价格敏感市场，棕榈油价格可能在4月跌破每吨4000林吉特（1017美元）。【原文：Palm oil may drop below 4,000 ringgit ($1,017) a ton by April as it competes with a flood of South American soy oil in price-sensitive markets like India, according to veteran trader, Dorab Mistry.】

item.title: 俄罗斯原油产量萎缩，美国加大能源施压力度
item.description: 俄罗斯原油产量1月份连续第二个月下滑，作为全球第三大产油国，该国因美国制裁而面临销售困境。【原文：Russia’s crude output declined for a second straight month in January as the world’s third largest oil producer faces difficulty in marketing its barrels because of US sanctions.】

item.title: 纽蒙特要求巴里克在首次公开募股前整顿内华达州业务
item.description: Newmont Corp., a partner with Barrick Mining Corp. in its most important mines, wants the Canadian company to improve the operations before it spins off the assets and believes it has the power to potentially block the initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: 印度重塑深科技融资规则以激发创新
item.description: India has redefined what qualifies as a deep tech startup and extended eligibility to 20 years, a move aimed at boosting frontier innovation by offering tax incentives and government funding.

item.title: Small Caps Flourish as US Earnings Growth Broadens Beyond Tech
item.description: 在经济增长韧性十足的背景下，美国中小型企业正迎来强劲的财报季，这表明近期市场从科技巨头转向其他板块的轮动趋势仍有持续空间。【原文：Smaller US companies are enjoying a robust earnings season amid resilient economic growth, suggesting a recent market rotation away from technology heavyweights has further to run.】

item.title: 德意志银行与贝莱德合并外汇技术，力求实现资金流自动化
item.description: 德意志银行与贝莱德公司正携手合作，旨在为投资者提供更便捷的外汇交易服务。此举源于资产管理公司正致力于削减成本并优化运营流程。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG and BlackRock Inc. are teaming up to help make foreign exchange easier for investors, as asset managers look to cut costs and streamline their operations.】

item.title: 英国监管机构加速审批防务基金，欧洲各国竞相重整军备
item.description: 英国金融行为监管局将优先处理专注于国防领域的基金申请，以应对日益动荡的地缘政治格局，从而加强国家安全。【原文：The Financial Conduct Authority will prioritize applications from defense-focused funds as the UK looks to bolster national security in the face of an increasingly uncertain geopolitical landscape.】

item.title: 高市早苗称赞日本强制令，希望与市场建立信任
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi hailed her strong mandate in an election win on Monday and vowed to build trust with financial markets as concerns grow over how she’ll pay for a planned tax cut.

item.title: 英飞凌加入人工智能融资热潮，一年来首次发行欧元债券
item.description: 英飞凌科技股份公司正发行一年来首笔欧元债券，加入科技企业融资浪潮，以支持雄心勃勃的人工智能项目。【原文：Infineon Technologies AG is raising its first euro debt in a year as it joins the tide of issuance from tech borrowers seeking to fund ambitious artificial intelligence projects.】

item.title: Israel’s El Al Fined $39 Million Over Wartime Airfare Hikes
item.description: 以色列监管机构拟对国家航空公司以色列航空处以3900万美元（1.21亿谢克尔）罚款，因其在以色列与哈马斯冲突期间不公平地提高机票价格——当时多数外国航空公司已暂停飞往该国的航班。【原文：An Israeli regulator is set to impose a $39 million (121 million shekel) fine against national carrier El Al Israel Airlines for unfairly raising airfare prices during the Israel-Hamas war, when most foreign airlines suspended flights to the country.】

item.title: 印度主要农民团体反对美印贸易协定
item.description: 印度最大的农民团体之一本周将按计划举行全国性抗议活动，因外界持续担忧新德里在与美国达成的临时贸易协议中是否在农业领域作出了过多让步。【原文：One of India’s largest farmer groups will proceed with a planned nationwide protest this week, as concerns persist over whether New Delhi has made too many concessions in agriculture under an interim trade deal with the US.】

item.title: Vitol Pushes Back Peak Oil Demand Forecast to Mid-2030s
item.description: 全球最大的独立石油贸易商维托集团表示，由于电动汽车普及速度缓慢，石油需求达到峰值的时间将比此前预估的更长。【原文：Vitol Group, the world’s largest independent oil trader, said oil demand will take longer to peak than it previously estimated because of slow take-up of electric vehicles.】

item.title: 里卡多·豪斯曼解析委内瑞拉经济崩溃的根源

item.title: 欧盟警告Meta开放WhatsApp平台接入竞争对手AI聊天机器人
item.description: Meta Platforms公司因在WhatsApp上封禁竞争对手人工智能助手的行为收到欧盟警告，这可能加剧其与特朗普政府在监管美国科技公司问题上的紧张关系。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. was given a European Union warning over policies that block the use of rival Artificial Intelligence assistants on WhatsApp, raising the possibility of further tensions with the Trump administration over the regulation of US tech companies.】

item.title: 亚马逊深化与芯片制造商意法半导体在数据中心领域的合作
item.description: 亚马逊公司旗下云服务AWS正深化与法意合资芯片制造商意法半导体公司的合作，以确保其数据中心获得半导体技术支持。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s cloud service AWS is deepening its ties with Franco-Italian chipmaker STMicroelectronics NV to secure semiconductor technologies for its data centers.】

item.title: 英国国债下跌，因对斯塔默的压力引发市场动荡
item.description: 英国首相基尔·斯塔默的幕僚长辞职后，首相面临的压力加剧，国债价格应声下跌。【原文：Gilts fell as pressure on UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer intensifies following the resignation of his chief of staff.】

item.title: 白宫下令后印度俄罗斯原油进口量预计减半
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在特朗普总统发布命令详细说明美俄贸易协议部分条款后，印度从俄罗斯进口的石油量可能从近期已然疲软的水平进一步减少近半。【原文：India’s imports of Russian oil could almost halve from already weaker recent levels, according to people with direct knowledge of the purchases, after US President Donald Trump issued an order detailing some terms of a trade deal between the two nations.】

item.title: 南非农产品出口创历史新高，而美国出口量却暴跌
item.description: 2025年南非农产品出口额创下151亿美元的年度纪录，尽管下半年对美国的出口量大幅下滑。【原文：South African agricultural exports hit an annual record of $15.1 billion in 2025, even as shipments to the US slumped in the second half of the year.】

item.title: 阿波罗与施罗德联手向高净值投资者销售基金
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司正与施罗德集团携手开发面向财富管理及养老金客户的基金产品。双方预期通过此次战略合作，最终将实现每年数十亿美元的资产募集规模。【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. is teaming up with Schroders Plc to develop funds for wealth and pension clients, in a strategic partnership the firms expect to ultimately raise billions of dollars in assets per year.】

item.title: Advent与联邦快递牵头的财团将以78亿欧元估值收购InPost
item.description: 由私募股权公司Advent International LP和联邦快递公司牵头的投资者集团，已同意以78亿欧元（约合93亿美元）收购波兰智能包裹柜公司InPost SA。【原文：Investors led by buyout firm Advent International LP and FedEx Corp. agreed to buy Polish parcel-locker company InPost SA in a deal that values the business at €7.8 billion ($9.3 billion).】
